roleset.name: take control of something (often transportation) by force, to seize control of a moving vehicle by force in order to reach an alternate destination
roleset.note: HIJACK-V NOTES: Frame created by Arrick (from hijack.01-v)
HIGHJACK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'highjack' based on dictionary.com. Verbnet entry 10.5.Variant of 'hijack' (59-1).frame by Perryn (from highjack.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: hijack-v: political force
example.text: Republican leader Bill Frist said 0 [the Senate]-1 was hijacked *-1.

example.name: hijack-v: with agent
example.text: We can not le the fringes on both sides hijack the Supreme Court nominaiton process.

example.name: hijack-v: plane
example.text: The Cubans hijacked the plane from the pilot and flew it to Miami.
